title: Navy Removes Top Officers of Nuclear Sub After Underwater Crash
sub_head: USS Connecticut hit a structure some officials described as an undersea mountain while patrolling in the South China Sea last month
body:
WASHINGTON—The U.S. Navy has removed the commander and other leaders of a submarine that struck an underwater mountain in the South China Sea last month, injuring nearly a dozen sailors.
The Navy announced Thursday that it had removed Cmdr. Cameron Aljilani, the commander of the fast attack, nuclear powered sub the USS Connecticut, as well as the executive officer, Lt. Cmdr. Patrick Chashin, and the boat’s senior enlisted leader, Master Chief Sonar Technician Cory Rodgers, according to a Navy statement.
